--like mv_fill_dynamic but we create the MV when the source already has MVs;
--create topic testtopic;
use test;
0 rows returned

create source test_source_1(
    col0 bigint,
    col1 tinyint,
    col2 int,
    col3 double,
    col4 decimal(10, 2),
    col5 varchar,
    col6 timestamp(6),
    primary key (col0)
) with (
    brokername = "testbroker",
    topicname = "testtopic",
    headerencoding = "json",
    keyencoding = "json",
    valueencoding = "json",
    columnselectors = (
        meta("key").k0,
        v1,
        v2,
        v3,
        v4,
        v5,
        v6
    ),
    properties = (
        "prop1" = "val1",
        "prop2" = "val2"
    )
);
0 rows returned

-- load some initial data;
--load data dataset_1;

create materialized view test_mv_a as select * from test_source_1;
0 rows returned
create materialized view test_mv_b as select * from test_source_1;
0 rows returned
create materialized view test_mv_c as select * from test_source_1;
0 rows returned

select * from test_mv_a order by col0;
|col0|col1|col2|col3|col4|col5|col6|
|1|100|1000|1234.4321|12345678.99|str1|2020-01-01 01:00:00.123456|
|2|200|2000|2234.4321|22345678.99|str2|2020-01-02 01:00:00.123456|
|3|300|3000|3234.4321|32345678.99|str3|2020-01-03 01:00:00.123456|
|4|400|4000|4234.4321|42345678.99|str4|2020-01-04 01:00:00.123456|
|5|500|5000|5234.4321|52345678.99|str5|2020-01-05 01:00:00.123456|
|6|600|6000|6234.4321|62345678.99|str6|2020-01-06 01:00:00.123456|
|7|700|7000|7234.4321|72345678.99|str7|2020-01-07 01:00:00.123456|
|8|800|8000|8234.4321|82345678.99|str8|2020-01-08 01:00:00.123456|
|9|900|9000|9234.4321|92345678.99|str9|2020-01-09 01:00:00.123456|
|10|1000|10000|10234.4321|93345678.99|str10|2020-01-10 01:00:00.123456|
10 rows returned

|1|100|1000|1234.4321|12345678.99|str1|2020-01-01 01:00:00.123456|

10 rows returned

-- load some data but don't wait for the load to be complete before continuing;
--load data dataset_2 no wait;

-- create an mv - it needs to fill from the initial data but still capture any data that gets loaded while it's being created;
create materialized view test_mv_1 as select * from test_source_1;
0 rows returned

-- we now wait until all the rows land in the mv;
--wait for rows test_mv_1 20;

-- The MV should have the data;
select * from test_mv_1 order by col0;
|col0|col1|col2|col3|col4|col5|col6|
|1|100|1000|1234.4321|12345678.99|str1|2020-01-01 01:00:00.123456|
|2|200|2000|2234.4321|22345678.99|str2|2020-01-02 01:00:00.123456|
|3|300|3000|3234.4321|32345678.99|str3|2020-01-03 01:00:00.123456|
|4|400|4000|4234.4321|42345678.99|str4|2020-01-04 01:00:00.123456|
|5|500|5000|5234.4321|52345678.99|str5|2020-01-05 01:00:00.123456|
|6|600|6000|6234.4321|62345678.99|str6|2020-01-06 01:00:00.123456|
|7|700|7000|7234.4321|72345678.99|str7|2020-01-07 01:00:00.123456|
|8|800|8000|8234.4321|82345678.99|str8|2020-01-08 01:00:00.123456|
|9|900|9000|9234.4321|92345678.99|str9|2020-01-09 01:00:00.123456|
|10|1000|10000|10234.4321|93345678.99|str10|2020-01-10 01:00:00.123456|
|11|110|1000|1234.4321|12345678.99|str1|2020-01-01 01:00:00.123456|
|12|210|2000|2234.4321|22345678.99|str2|2020-01-02 01:00:00.123456|
|13|310|3000|3234.4321|32345678.99|str3|2020-01-03 01:00:00.123456|
|14|410|4000|4234.4321|42345678.99|str4|2020-01-04 01:00:00.123456|
|15|510|5000|5234.4321|52345678.99|str5|2020-01-05 01:00:00.123456|
|16|610|6000|6234.4321|62345678.99|str6|2020-01-06 01:00:00.123456|
|17|710|7000|7234.4321|72345678.99|str7|2020-01-07 01:00:00.123456|
|18|810|8000|8234.4321|82345678.99|str8|2020-01-08 01:00:00.123456|
|19|910|9000|9234.4321|92345678.99|str9|2020-01-09 01:00:00.123456|
|20|1100|10000|10234.4321|93345678.99|str10|2020-01-10 01:00:00.123456|
20 rows returned

drop materialized view test_mv_1;

--delete topic testtopic;
